page.title: 02ROOKWOODS, WATERLANE.
page.content: {Rookwoods}is a fine well kept{17th {century}gabled house on the western side of the valley of the Holy Brook. It is built of Cotswold stone,with a stone tile roof.Two extensions,of similar building style and materials have been added in the last 40 years. Documents record a house called {'Rockwude'}on this site as early as {1190,}this was probably part of a {medieval farm.}The present house was once a barn.Inside there is a celler and several big open fireplaces and lots of old oak beams.In a barn in the grounds there is an old cider press, also an original cobbled stable which is now used as a storeroom.The gardens are beautiful and are open to the public twice a year in the summer. There are lots of old fashioned roses and a large amount of lawn.
